title: Ranged weapon
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Ranged_weapon/zh-CN "Ranged weapon/zh-CN")

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, a **ranged weapon** is any type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that can be used to attack a monster not adjacent to the [player](/wiki/Player "Player") character. While technically any item in the game can be considered a ranged weapon if it can be thrown or otherwise used in such a manner, only certain weapons are actually designated for use as [projectiles](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") in this manner by the [source code](/wiki/Source_code "Source code"):[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- all [spears](/wiki/Spear "Spear") (dwarvish spear, silver spear, elven spear, spear, orcish spear) including [javelins](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin")
- [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")
- all types of [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow") ([ya](/wiki/Ya "Ya"), [silver arrow](/wiki/Silver_arrow "Silver arrow"), [elven arrow](/wiki/Elven_arrow "Elven arrow"), [arrow](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow"), [orcish arrow](/wiki/Orcish_arrow "Orcish arrow")) and [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt")
- all [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") (silver dagger, elven dagger, dagger, orcish dagger) and the [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife")
- all stones ([flint stone](/wiki/Flint_stone "Flint stone"), [rock](/wiki/Rock "Rock"), [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone"), [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"))
- [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang")
- [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie")

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"expand or merge"*

## Monster usage

The order of preference in which hostile monsters will use a ranged weapon is:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

1. [cockatrice egg](/wiki/Cockatrice_egg "Cockatrice egg"),
2. [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie") for [Keystone Kops](/wiki/Keystone_Kop_\(monster_class\) "Keystone Kop (monster class)"),
3. [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") for [giants](/wiki/Giant "Giant"),
4. [polearms](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") or [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance") if you are in range,
5. the above list, in order of priority and if a necessary launcher is available.

Gems are inserted into said above list between luckstone and darts. Polearms can only be used by "strong" monsters without a [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") - the preference of [polearms](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") is: [halberd](/wiki/Halberd "Halberd"), [bardiche](/wiki/Bardiche "Bardiche"), [spetum](/wiki/Spetum "Spetum"), [bill-guisarme](/wiki/Bill-guisarme "Bill-guisarme"), [voulge](/wiki/Voulge "Voulge"), [ranseur](/wiki/Ranseur "Ranseur"), [guisarme](/wiki/Guisarme "Guisarme"), [glaive](/wiki/Glaive "Glaive"), [lucern\_hammer](/wiki/Lucern_hammer "Lucern hammer"), [bec\_de\_corbin](/wiki/Bec_de_corbin "Bec de corbin"), [fauchard](/wiki/Fauchard "Fauchard"), [partisan](/wiki/Partisan "Partisan"), [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance").

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"1)Does a monster need a weapon attack to be able to use ranged weapons? 2) Track the calls to select\_rwep - can confused/conflicted/scared/fleeing/healthy pets/hostiles/priests/shopkeepers/covetous monsters use ranged stuff?"*

## See Also

- [projectile](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile")
- [Pet#Weapons](/wiki/Pet#Weapons "Pet") lists the order of preference of melee weapons

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [weapon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 341](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/weapon.c#line341 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/weapon.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [select\_rwep](/wiki/Source:Weapon.c#select_rwep "Source:Weapon.c") in [weapon.c](/wiki/Source:Weapon.c "Source:Weapon.c")

Ranged weapon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎

In NetHack, a ranged weapon is any type of weapon that can be used to attack a monster not adjacent to the player character. While technically any item in the game can be considered a ranged weapon if it can be thrown or otherwise used in such a manner, only certain weapons are actually designated for use as projectiles in this manner by the source code:[1]

  • all spears (dwarvish spear, silver spear, elven spear, spear, orcish spear) including javelins
  • shuriken
  • all types of arrows (ya, silver arrow, elven arrow, arrow, orcish arrow) and crossbow bolts
  • all daggers (silver dagger, elven dagger, dagger, orcish dagger) and the knife
  • all stones (flint stone, rock, loadstone, luckstone)
  • dart
  • boomerang
  • cream pie

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"expand or merge"

Monster usage

The order of preference in which hostile monsters will use a ranged weapon is:[2]

  1. cockatrice egg,
  2. cream pie for Keystone Kops,
  3. boulders for giants,
  4. polearms or lance if you are in range,
  5. the above list, in order of priority and if a necessary launcher is available.

Gems are inserted into said above list between luckstone and darts. Polearms can only be used by "strong" monsters without a shield - the preference of polearms is: halberd, bardiche, spetum, bill-guisarme, voulge, ranseur, guisarme, glaive, lucern_hammer, bec_de_corbin, fauchard, partisan, lance.
